result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen M. Walber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Allen M. Walber is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Allen M. Walber was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Jail term is with huber privileges.
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge. May have NO CONTACT with victims (Hoeffs or LaPlaca). Submit an apology to victims in way and manner to be determined by agent.
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Jail term is to commence within 15 days of 07-28-15.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
DE must maintain absolute sobriety. DE may not possess firearms. DE must comply with any counseling. DE to submit a DNA sample and pay surcharges. DE to take medications as prescribed. DE to comply with any assessments required by probation agent.
DE has 48 hours from release to update Clerks office of address and 30 days from release to begin payment of $25 per month and each month thereafter.
Submit to AODA assessment and comply with any recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Allen M. Walber
Current: N8646 E WILSON, Phillips, WI 54555 United States  (Effective: 04-07-2021)
Prior: N8646 E. Wilson Flowage Road, Phillips, WI 54555

11:15 AM - Court calls cases 14CF68 and 17CF27 (SEHR), 18CF77 and 18CM107 (PLEAS) and 18CM107(init) and states appearances. Defendant Allen M. Walber in court with attorney Jessica Fehrenbach.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA certifies Victim Rights Compliance. Parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet and waive reading. Comments and recommendations by DA. Comment by Atty Fehrenbach. Comment by DE. Summation by Court. Court imposes on Revocation cases:

14CF68
5.5 years prison consisting of 2.5 initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision, cc to 17CF27, 353 days sentence credit
Reimpose all prior monetary obligation with credit for payments made
AODA and followthough with any recommendations. DE must maintain absolute sobriety. DE may not possess firearms, DE must comply with any counseling, Submit DNA and pay surcharges. DE to take medications as prescribed. DE to comply with any assessments requiredd by probation agent.  

17CF27
3 years prison consisting of 1.5 initial confinement and 1.5 years extended supervision, cc to 14CF68, 185 days sentence credit
Reimpose all prior monetary obligation with credit for payments made
AODA and followthough with any recommendations. DE must maintain absolute sobriety. DE may not possess firearms, DE must comply with any counseling, Submit DNA and pay surcharges. DE to take medications as prescribed. DE to comply with any assessments requiredd by probation agent.  

Eligible for ERP and Challenge Incarceration Program.  

DA states agreement in 18CF77 and 18CM107. DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct 2 in 18CF77.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire. Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct 2. On motion of DA, Court dismisses and read in Cts 1 & 3 on 18CF77 as well as 18CM107. Statement by victim HS. Court imposes:

Ct 2
$243 cc
$200 DNAAS
90 days jail with huber and goodtime, cc with 2 days credit

48 hours from release to update Clerks office of address

30 day from release to begin payments $25 per month, and each month thereafter

Appeal right given
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 20, 2018 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
11:10 am - Defendant Allen M. Walber appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DA certifies victims rights compliance. DA moves to amend Ct. 2 to Burglary as PTAC. So ordered. Information has been provided and waive reading. Amended information will be provided. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct. 2.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 2 and on motion of DA dismisses Ct. 1 and Ct. 3. Comments by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 11:37 am. 
Court imposes (Ct. 2):
Sentence withheld - 3 years probation.
Conditions:
6 month jail term, with huber privileges, with credit for 15 days time served, to commence within 15 days from 07-28-15
$870 fine
$130 SBDA
Apology
No contact with victims Hoeffs or LaPlaca
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Obtain and maintain full-time employment
AODA

11:05 am - Defendant Allen M. Walber appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to no miranda good child issues.  So ordered.  Adj. 11:06 am.
Jury trial on May 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on January 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.
see minutes on today's date under preliminary hearing event

11:02 am - Defendant Allen M. Walber appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Brett Foley called and sworn.  Direct by DA.  Cross by Atty. Lex.  Court finds probable cause that DE committed a felony and binds over for trial.  DA files information.  Parties have received and reviewed and waive reading.  DE pleads NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Bond to continue.  Adj. 11:16 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE may not have contact with Crista A. Hoefs or Melissa LaPlaca unless there is written consent on file nor go on their residence (W8828 Danish Settlement Rd.) now or in the future.  Bond to be co-signed by surety/sureties.

Defendant Allen M. Walber appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Atty. Lex moves to amend bond.  Comments by DA.  Further comments by Atty. Lex.  Comments and ruling by Court.  Modify bond to $500 cash and $1500 signature bond with same conditions to be co-signed by surety/sureties.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.
